Description: Mould-made pottery lamp with a double-convex body, a small sunken discus surrounded by a groove, and a raised base, concave below. The long flat-topped nozzle has a splayed end and a curved tip, and is decorated with volutes at its junction with the shoulder. On the left side of the shoulder is a dolphin.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q598)
